poem:
Title: "Bethlehem Unadorned"

In Bethlehem's centre, the lights dim,
An unnatural, grievous hymn.
No choirs carol in candle-glow,
No trees, no tinselled snow.

The manger lies, splintered in strife,
Cutting through peace like a crude knife.
Where swaddled Hope, in a keffiyeh tied,
Sleeps in rubble, dream crucified.

Must merriment kneel to sorrow's yoke,
When cradle and cross are cloaked in smoke?
Yet, in stark silence, we shall remember,
The stark echo of a silent December.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
